intro: Rhynchospora alba, commonly known as the white beakspur, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in the Americas. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in marshy areas and is often found in association with other wetland vegetation. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces distinctive, spike-like inflorescences. Rhynchospora alba plays a role in supporting local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
